name: #1 of Ku Klux Klan March Series – Austin, Texas November 1965
description: This series consists of original slides taken during the KKK march to the State Capitol in Austin, Texas on November 7th, 1965.  During this era of civil unrest and anti-war protests in Austin, the Ku Klux Klan received permission to march in a pro-Vietnam war demonstration.  They were received by a largely peaceful but quite loud opposing group of citizens and students during this moment of history. This photo shows the Klan members and anti-Klan protesters as the Klan is about to enter the Texas Capitol grounds off of Congress Avenue in downtown Austin. Taken with a Praktica FX2 camera on 35mm Kodachrome film.
